Math.Display.Calculator

Class MainClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • Math.Display.Calculator.MainClass

  • public class MainClass
extends java.lang.Object
    The frame that holds all the buttons and displays for the calculator.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MainClass()
      The constructor for MainClass, which creates the calculator Window.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main function, which creates an instance of MainClass, and runs it.
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments passed from the command line.

      • setUpAndDrawGraph

        public void setUpAndDrawGraph(java.lang.String eq)
        Overloaded setUpAndDrawGraph function, taking only the eq argument. This calls setUpAndDrawGraph with EQUATION as eq, LIMIT as 10, and STEP as 0.1D.
        Parameters:
        eq - The equation that will be passed along to graph.

      • setUpAndDrawGraph

        public void setUpAndDrawGraph(java.lang.String eq,
                              double step)
        Overloaded setUpAndDrawGraph function, taking the eq and step arguments. This calls setUpAndDrawGraph with EQUATION as eq, LIMIT as 10, and STEP as step.
        Parameters:
        eq - The equation that will be passed along to graph.
        step - The amount that x will be incremented when graphing.

      • setUpAndDrawGraph

        public void setUpAndDrawGraph(java.lang.String eq,
                              int limit)
        Overloaded setUpAndDrawGraph function, taking the eq and limit arguments. This calls setUpAndDrawGraph with EQUATION as eq, LIMIT as limit, and STEP as 0.1D.
        Parameters:
        eq - The equation that will be passed along to graph.
        limit - The x and y boundries for the graph. For example, if limit = 10, the boundries would be (-10x, 10x, -10y, 10y).

      • setUpAndDrawGraph

        public void setUpAndDrawGraph(java.lang.String rawEq,
                              int limit,
                              double step)
        Draws a graph of the passed equation(s) on the screen, along with axis. Note: EquationDisplay is used to display the graph.
        Parameters:
        rawEq - The equation(s) that will be graphed by EquationDisplay.
        limit - The outermost boundries, outside of which the equation wont be graphed.
        step - The amount that x will be incremented by. The smaller it is, the more percise the graph.
        See Also:
        EquationDisplay
